definition: dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: He expressed a non-mainstream thinking of the tendencies of individualism in his works.
sentences.chinese: 在其作品中袒露出非主流思想的个人主义倾向。

sentences.english: Place a tape measure around your bare abdomen just above your hipbone.
sentences.chinese: 袒露出你的肚子，用卷尺在胯骨之上环绕一圈。

sentences.english: The street expose the lonely face.
sentences.chinese: 街道袒露出它孤独的面容。

sentences.english: Exposed with hands as empty, as the opposite space.
sentences.chinese: 空着双手将一切袒露，如同这相逆的空间。

sentences.english: We were afraid of everything that might reveal our secret to ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我们畏怯可能向我们自己袒露出我们机密的任何事情。

sentences.english: Zhou Mai exposes the intent that determination lets go to her finally, pluvial contain equipment is stricken.
sentences.chinese: 周迈最后向她袒露决心放手的意图，雨涵备受打击。

definition: to expose (to the air, light etc)/to leave uncovered/exposure
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
